riddles.riddle: What has keys but no locks?
I speak without a mouth and hear without ears. I have no body, but I come alive with wind. What am I?
What has hands but cannot clap?
riddles.hint: You check it to know the time

riddles.riddle: I am taken from a mine and shut up in a wooden case from which I am never released, and yet I am used by almost everyone. What am I?
riddles.hint: Graphite comes from mines, and it's used for writing

riddles.riddle: The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
What has a head, a tail, is brown, and has no legs?
I have cities, but no houses. I have mountains, but no trees. I have water, but no fish. What am I?
What gets wetter as it dries?
What has to be broken before you can use it?
I am not alive, but I grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
